Comments_List: A better understanding of African American art, and the history of its creative expression. The political discourse for African Americans in the 1920's and how popular thinkers of the time tried to gain social capitol by way of art.

The strength is in the exploration of the material. The writings are still fresh, resonating with the class and giving room to discuss not only the technique of each piece individually, but how their narrative relate to contemporary issues. The weakness would be it relies heavily on student contribution and discussion, so the quality of the class would be directly linked to the engagement of your classmates.
Yes. It would be an ideal way to get a writing credit. Varied forms of writing (biographical, peoms, prose, novel ect) will keep them from getting fatigued.
